intro: Pleopeltis zippelii, commonly known as the Zippel’s rock fern, is a species of epiphytic fern native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its compact, clustered growth habit. The plant features lanceolate, serrated leaves that are typically dark green and glossy. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often growing on tree trunks or rocky surfaces. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is a subject of interest in both horticulture and botanical research.
